text.eng: Please click Play.
Please enter your answer.
Rick
Customer
Facilities Manager
Cup Choice
Foam
In-store
Recyclable
Biodegradable
Type of Cup
After a Cup is Used
Smoothie Shop
Smoothie
SHOP
You work at Natural Smoothies, a store in the Waterbridge Mall.\n\nNatural Smoothies serves frozen fruit drinks.
Your boss is Rick, the owner.
Rick has told you his goals for Natural Smoothies:
Use only all-natural ingredients.
Come up with one new flavor per month.
Increase customer satisfaction.
Keep costs low for customers.
One day, a customer says something to Rick.

I love that you're using all-natural ingredients.\n\nBut the cups you are using are bad for the environment because they're made of foam. When they're thrown out, they will sit in the landfill for hundreds of years.
Our shop should be all about being natural!
After hearing the customer's comment, Rick announces a new goal:
Reduce the waste produced by Natural Smoothies.
Rick assigns you to:
Research alternatives to the current foam cups.
Advise him on what changes Natural Smoothies should make to its cups.
Your research shows that Natural Smoothies' foam cups:
cannot be recycled
do not biodegrade or break down into the soil
So the customer was right to say,
"They will sit in the landfill for hundreds of years."
Rick asks you to look into using in-store cups.
Using only in-store cups sounds like a good idea. That way we'd have no foam cups to worry about at all.
Your research shows this information about in-store cups.
It is washed and then reused.
Now read some comments from Natural Smoothies customers about their shopping habits and drink preferences.
Customer Comments
"I like Rick's smoothies because they're healthy and affordable."
"I never think about buying a smoothie until after I get to the mall."
"I like spending time in the Natural Smoothies shop."
"I like to sip my smoothie when I walk around the mall."
Select the customer who would find the switch to in-store cups LEAST convenient. Click Submit when you are finished.
A survey shows that a lot of Natural Smoothies' customers want the convenience of taking their drinks out of the shop, but they will not bring their own travel mugs into the shop.
Answer the question below. Then click Submit.
How can Rick BEST satisfy customers AND reduce waste?
Ask customers to drink their smoothies inside the shop.
Give customers coupons to purchase travel mugs online.
Offer all customers the choice of an in-store cup or a foam cup.
Raise the price of the smoothies and give travel mugs to all customers.
Based on the survey results, Rick has a new plan. He will offer customers a choice of cups.
We can offer two cup choices! Foam cups and in-store cups would make everyone happy. That definitely sounds better than in-store cups alone!
Answer the questions below. When you are finished, click Submit.
Which TWO goals will the new cup-choice plan help Rick meet?
Use only all-natural ingredients.
Come up with one new flavor per month.
Increase customer satisfaction.
Reduce the waste produced by Natural Smoothies.
Explain how the new plan will help Rick achieve these goals.
Rick decides to start offering the cup-choice plan immediately. After a month, the pattern is clear.
Customers choose
an in-store cup 20 percent of the time
a foam cup 80 percent of the time
PERCENT OF DRINKS SERVED
Because so many people are NOT choosing in-store cups, Rick asks you for alternative ideas to foam cups.
You tell Rick about the possibility of using recyclable cups.
It can be turned back into raw material for new cups (or other things).
Rick decides to
replace the foam cups with recyclable cups
Rick assumes that 80 percent of drinks will now be served in recyclable cups.
After a few weeks, you hear this report from the mall's facilities manager.

Even though a lot of our stores are now using recyclable food containers, we are not collecting as much recyclable material as we expected.\n\nI've looked into it, and it appears that people are putting most recyclable cups in the regular trash, which goes to the landfill.
From your research, you know that recyclable cups will not decompose in a landfill. In order to be recycled, they must be put in the mall's recycling bins.
You decide to investigate why customers throw their cups into the regular trash instead of recycling them. You discover three important facts.
Fact 1:
There are only two recycling bins in the mall (and they are far from Rick's shop).
Fact 2:
Most customers don't know the difference between recyclable and nonrecyclable cups.
Fact 3:
Most customers don't think about the environment when they throw away their cups.
Reasons customers do not recycle
Based on the facts you have learned, what TWO things could be done to encourage people to recycle their cups? When you are finished, click Submit.
Waterbridge Mall
Suggested Change
There are not many recycling bins in the mall.
Increase the number of recycling bins in the mall.
Would the suggested change help inform customers about how to dispose of their cups properly?
Would the suggested change help make recycling more convenient for customers?
Seven different stores in the mall sell food in recyclable containers.
Inform all the other stores that many customers are not using recycling bins.
The recycling symbol on cups is very small and is imprinted on the bottom of the cup.
Make sure that cups say "Recycle Me in the Blue Bin!" in big letters on the side of the cup.
It sure is hard to get people to recycle!\n\nWhat if we used biodegradable cups instead of recyclable cups?
It breaks down into natural components that can become part of the soil.
We can offer a biodegradable cup to people who want to take their drinks out of the shop. Wouldn't it be great if they could throw the biodegradable cups in the regular trash?
Rick wants to make sure biodegradable cups are a good option. He asks you to research biodegradable cups. This is what you find:
Biodegradable Cups
Cost 25 percent more than recyclable cups
Made of materials that take only two months to decompose in a special facility
If thrown in the regular trash, could take over a hundred years to decompose in a landfill
Can hold liquid ranging from 0º to 115º F
Leak-safe up to 3 hours
Why mall customers did not recycle
Answer the questions below and click Submit. Click Fact Sheet to review reasons that customers don't recycle.
Will offering biodegradable cups solve all of the problems that were seen with the use of recyclable cups?
Explain your answer in the box below

You agree with Rick that it is hard to get people to recycle and perhaps biodegradable cups aren't the answer. You talk to the mall manager again and she tells you about one shop that seems to be more successful at recycling.
Kandy's Candies sells hot chocolate in recyclable cups. We have never seen a Kandy's Candies hot chocolate cup in the regular trash!

When customers bring their hot chocolate cups back to the shop, Kandy's Candies gives customers a discount on their next purchase.

Kandy can offer a discount because she sells the used cups to a manufacturer who crushes them and turns them into kitchen countertops.

Everyone wins!
Kandy's Candies successfully recycles hot chocolate cups by selling the used cups to a local countertop manufacturer. Customers get a discount card for their next purchase.
Customers can bring it back to the shop to receive a discount card for their next purchase.
Improved technology might not be enough to solve problems.
People enjoy the benefits that come from mastering new technologies.
The environment is important to many people.
Card Plan

Now, you need to convince Rick to use a discount-card plan for customers who bring back their recyclable cups.\n\nHe will be able to sell the used cups to the countertop manufacturer and offer his customers a discount card for their next purchase.
Customers will bring back their cups in exchange for a discount card. Rick will sell the used cups to the countertop manufacturer.
How can Rick's card plan help the environment?
How can Rick's card plan help his business make more money?
When you are finished, click Submit.
Rick likes your idea.\n\nBy offering discounts to customers who bring back their recyclable cups, Rick has now satisfied all of his goals!
